EmailTemplate.subject: Opportunities to work for NCS with the Challenge in 2014
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
APPLICATIONS ARE OPEN
A big THANK YOU from all of us at The Challenge for all your hard work during our 2013 programmes. Your contribution to NCS with The Challenge was invaluable and we hope you will return to work with us again in 2014.
Read on to find out about Applications; the chance to win £50 worth of Amazon vouchers; exciting opportunities to be a University Rep and the winners of our feedback competition.
Applications
You will receive an email asking you to reapply. All returning staff will need to make an application (http://thechallenge.force.com/TCN/New_Job_Application) because we have an exciting new system this year. As a returner, once you have applied your application will be fast tracked.
Refer your friends to enter our prize draw for 5 x £50 Amazon vouchers 45% of people say they hear about us through word of mouth! So encourage anyone you know who is interested to apply and we will give out £50 Amazon vouchers to the top 5 people who generate the most referrals leading to an assessment (closing date 14 February 2014).
Ask your referrals to mention your name in the section ‘How did you hear about us?’
FUTURE OPPORTUNITIES
Love the programme? Want to stay involved? We are looking for you
You could work for The Challenge on your university campus and inspire fellow students to follow in your footsteps.
Student Marketing Representatives will assist in marketing NCS with The Challenge on university campuses. You will support our staffing team by carrying out promotional activities such as helping out at careers fairs/presentations.
Please click here (https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/VWPD8YC) to register your interest
Mentors Wanted Having worked with The Challenge, you probably know that there are many young people in London who would benefit from regular support. Continue to develop your mentoring skills with Friendship Works (http://www.friendshipworks.org.uk/).
For further details please see the following document: http://212.110.188.136/Mentoring_Friendship%20Works.pdf
Thank you for your feedback In October, we asked all our summer staff to give us feedback about their experience of working with us. It is important for us to continually improve and reflect on how the programme turned out. It was absolutely fantastic to read what you had to say.
All staff who submitted feedback were entered into a prize draw. The winners from our competition received Amazon vouchers; the winners were Alison Avery from Surrey, Joanna Darrington from South London, Naomi Thompson from North London and Kurt Cook from the West Midlands.
Congratulations to our winners!
Season’s Greetings and a Happy New Year
